TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 591
TEI.2.document_title: Juan Davis Brandburn to J F Madero, 01-29-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: Juan Davis Bradburn to Madero, January 29, 1831. Thinks the passage of the law of April 6, 1830, supersedes the permit granted by Federal authorities in 1828 to settlers in the border reserve. Suggests conference to agree on interpretation of the laws. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 591

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Juan Davis Bradburn to Madero, January 29, 1831. Thinks the passage of the law of April 6, 1830, supersedes the permit granted by Federal authorities in 1828 to settlers in the border reserve. Suggests conference to agree on interpretation of the laws. (Omitted.)*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Galveston Bay,*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="01-29-1831"> January 29, 1831*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*See Calendar.*/p*
*/div1*
